<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; This function takes a string with the passes that should be used. The format</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; of this string is the same as opt&#39;s -passes argument for the new pass</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; manager. Individual passes may be specified, separated by commas. Full</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; pipelines may also be invoked using &#96;default&lt;O3&gt;&#96; and friends. See opt for</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; Specify a custom alias analysis pipeline for the PassBuilder to be used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; instead of the default one. The string argument is not copied; the caller</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; is responsible for ensuring it outlives the PassBuilderOptions instance.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
